item.title: Dynamic Attention-controlled Cascaded Shape Regression Exploiting Training Data Augmentation and Fuzzy-set Sample Weighting
item.description: We present a new Cascaded Shape Regression (CSR) architecture, namely Dynamic Attention-Controlled CSR (DAC-CSR), for robust facial landmark detection on unconstrained faces. Our DAC-CSR divides facial landmark detection into three cascaded sub-tasks: face bounding box refinement, general CSR and attention-controlled CSR.

item.title: Efficient 3D Morphable Face Model Fitting
item.description: 3D face reconstruction of shape and skin texture from a single 2D image can be performed using a 3D Morphable Model (3DMM) in an analysis-by-synthesis approach. However, performing this reconstruction (fitting) efficiently and accurately in a general imaging scenario is a challenge.

item.title: Facial Recognition for Enhanced Security Applications
item.description: Professor Kittler visited New York University of Abu Dhabi (NYUAD) in the United Arab Emirates where he presented a keynote lecture on “Facial Recognition for Enhanced Security Applications” on 7 January 2017. The invited talk was opened to general public.

item.title: 3D Morphable Face Model and its Applications (at AMDO 2016)
item.description: Professor Josef Kittler presented an invited paper on 3D morphable face model and its applications at the International Conference on Articulated Motion and Deformable Models 2016, held at Palma, Mallorca during 13-15 July 2016.

item.title: Real-time 3D Face Super-resolution from Monocular In-the-wild Videos
item.description: A fully automatic approach to real-time 3D face reconstruction from monocular, 2D, in-the-wild videos is presented. We use a low-resolution 3D Morphable Face Model to obtain a semi-dense shape and combine it with a fast median-based super-resolution technique to obtain a high-fidelity textured 3D face model.

item.title: Extending NMF to 3D Registered Data
item.description: The use of non-negative matrix factorisation (NMF) on 2D face images has been shown to result in sparse feature vectors that encode for local patches on the face, and thus provides a statistically justified approach to learning parts from wholes.

item.title: 3D Morphable Face Model and its Applications
item.description: 3D Morphable Face Models (3DMM) have been used in face recognition for some time now. They can be applied in their own right as a basis for 3D face recognition and analysis involving 3D face data.
